context.description: Documentation fell out of sync with code due to unclear ownership of 'why' vs 'what' vs 'how' information.
context.problem: Contradictions emerged when information was updated in one location but not others. Need structural solution.

decision.summary: Adopt a 3-tier document model (ADRs → Specs → Guides) where each tier has exclusive responsibility for one question.

rules: Numbers are globally unique and never reused

positive: Clear mental model: 'Where do I document X?' has unambiguous answer
Future-proof onboarding: trace 'why → what → how' lineage
negative: Upfront cost for schema design and refactoring
Schemas may feel restrictive for edge cases

guardrails.rule: Each tier MUST have exactly one responsibility
Cross-tier references MUST flow ADRs → Specs → Guides
Each piece of information MUST exist in exactly one tier
